storyInfo: Patriot expresses his thoughts to Talulah for the first time, denouncing her as an empty idealist. Talulah picks up the children Sasha and Eno, and Alina reminds her not to forget the persistence she started with.

attributes.content: Thank you for your assistance, Mr...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: —Talulah.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: You want to leave the tundra? You will be crushed under the armor of Ursus.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Dad? Why right now? Didn't we alread—
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: The Shieldguards have already gone to collect resources. Take the squad. Order them all to move.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: ...Alright.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: You and your project will get everyone killed.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Talulah realizes. This is the first time the giant before her has personally issued his opinion. Even if that opinion is no shock, it still shakes her to the bone.
And the Northwestern Tundra can't keep us alive forever. The larger our group grows, the more food and energy supplies we need, and the villages that revile us far outnumber the ones that support us.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: One season of mossoats, each year... even if we all pitch in for the tilling, how much would we harvest in the end?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Will our fields be destroyed by the Patrol Unit? The guerrillas can easily dispose of them, but the other Infected can't.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You are hastening their deaths.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Our only choice is to leave the tundra. Not for Sami, and not for the barrens... we'll head east, head south, head for warmer places.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: How will you survive? How will you allow us all, so numerous, to survive?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: The guerrillas save people. The guerrillas sacrifice none but ourselves. Only warriors sacrifice themselves.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: But there are Infected in every city and their surroundings, so many more than there are on the tundra.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You permanently protect the north, detesting all that the Infected of the north endure... so you've had little chance to understand the kind of life the Infected of the south have.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Do they live well?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: They live miserably.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You want to absorb them.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: I intend to unite with them.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: When the Empire turns its gaze to the Infected, you will bear the brunt.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: I don't want them to unite by my side. No. I want them to unite under one encompassing philosophy.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Philosophy? The Infected are taken as sawdust on the tundra, as slag in the mines, as warnings in the villages, as unknown fuel in the cities.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: The tundra Infected are certainly not ignorant nor foolish. We do not cradle fantasy. All philosophies are fantasy before they are put into practice.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: On the tundra, there are still mines, patrol forces, foolish and lackadaisical guards. We have places to obtain our resources.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: The resources throughout this icy tundra will sooner or later be exhausted, because we have no method of extracting our own.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: We have no enduringly mobile nomadic city, no specially qualified Catastrophe Messengers...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Go to the city and we have nothing at all.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: We will earn new friends.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Who are your friends?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: I recognize your project has merit to it.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: But at the same time, it is also nothing special.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: How many strategists have died frustrated on the tundra? You speak of it, and I see no reason it could be done, nor on what it would be realized.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Why could the last Emperor make the land tremble? Because he held fast to it, never talking of any wild, far-flung vision. He only walked in steps.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Which you cannot do.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Sir!
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You say I may be crushed by the armor of Ursus, and I concede that. They will sooner or later turn their attention to us here.  There will always come a day when they catch us. None of us can escape it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: 'Let them come?' Is that how you approach it, sir?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That the tundra would prepare you better for a battle?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You are seeking a new battlefield?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: I'm looking for a chance to win.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: As far as so many more Infected are concerned, that's hope. But to fighters like you and me, that's a crossroads. The only crossroads where we can break from our intrinsic strategy.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: To wander the tundra, in the end, is still nothing more than a slow death... much like the little life we have left as Infected. I need to repeat this point, over and over, because we're all fully aware of it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Perhaps my daughter is convinced by you.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: But I will not be convinced by someone who has never lost hope in the truest sense, who has only ever spouted an empty miscellany of armchair strategies.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Talulah? Where are you going?
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: I'm fine. Just going to check if there are any survivors in the mines.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The guerrillas have already set out, and the village is starting the move too. The army isn't following our tracks, either...
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Dad? What's up with you?
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: *cough*...
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Just a normal cough.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: A rustling sound.
Is somebody there?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...I know you're all here. You're not with the army. You haven't even broken a twig with your steps.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I mean you no harm. If you're not Infected, I'll leave you be, unless you need assistance...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: D—don't come any closer!
Don't move! If you do, I'll shoot!
Ah.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: She's—she's Infected! Sasha, my Arts can drive Infected away...!
attributes.name: Timid Child

attributes.content: You can't use your Arts!
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: Sasha...
attributes.name: Timid Child

attributes.content: G—get out of here already! We were just getting things from the mines... we don't want to kill anyone!
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: I'll shoot! You'll die!
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: Sasha... you—when you say that...
attributes.name: Timid Child

attributes.content: How long have you gone without eating?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Why do you care?!
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: We're in the vicinity of a militarized mine. You wouldn't dare light a fire.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...The way you shake makes me think of wheat being sifted.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: *whine*...
attributes.name: Timid Child

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: Don't be scared.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Talulah grasps a branch with one hand.
Softly, gently, she hands this branch to the two children, and within it, small sparks dance out.
Ah...
attributes.name: Timid Child

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: It's warmer, now, isn't it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That's right, I really am Infected.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So that's how it happened.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: That's how you found Sasha and Eno... they were never willing to talk about the past.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: If we never found them, they would've certainly passed away.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Perhaps, ever since Patriot refuted me, it was the one bit of good I'd done.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So what's happened today, then?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: ...I was careless with my Arts during training, FrostNova's cloak was hung up nearby, and they spread to it. Now she's out for my life.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And you promised you'd help sew it back up?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: To tell the truth, Alina...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Oh, whatever. Give it to me. Knowing you, I'm scared you'd sew yourself to it.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Don't you want to join our group? If we have your gift with words, there's a decently better chance I'll talk Patriot over.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I've told you before, Talulah... My Arts would be useless with the guerrillas.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I can stand the blood, but I don't want the initiative to harm people myself. You'll be facing much more than just the Infected Patrol Unit, soon enough.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I suppose if I had dragged you along... I'd have been bothering you too much.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Ah, you put it that way on purpose, didn't you?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: No, I...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Don't remember wrong, now. It was I who wanted to go with you.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: And up to now, it's been for one reason. It's because... Talulah, I feel like there's every chance you'd forget.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Forget what?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Forget just what it is you want to do.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I've been striving all this time for the future of the Infected.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That's not what you said, back at the very start.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Talulah, we all know people can change.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: If bit by bit, we shake ourselves clean of all the things we've persevered with, or if we replace them with something new, then there's a certain point where we realize we just haven't persevered in anything, right?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: In a constant battle and with things changing all the time, it's only natural I'd alter my policy. If rigor sets into our thinking, it could very well make us weaker.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And where'd that stubborn part of you go?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Do you want to prove that the Infected are just like normal people? Or do you want to prove that normal people are just like the Infected?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: What's the difference?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: If there's only Infected, then who's even a normal person? Would we want all people to catch Oripathy? Or to cut ourselves off completely from the normal people?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: But if there were only normal people, no Infected... then the people who caught Oripathy would be normal people underneath, normal like the people who haven't.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Elders are just normal people, Ancients are just normal people, villagers who all know each other are normal people, and whoever's living in the cities should be normal people all the same.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Talulah, do you want to return to your family?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: You're all my family.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: No, we aren't.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: If we cleared all this Oripathy off our skin... would we be able to go back home?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: You and I are of a mind on this. We couldn't.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The tundra, and our lives, have completely changed us. The Infected already have no way of returning to their former lives.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Talulah, do you feel proud of yourself for being Infected now?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Why would you ask?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Because you can cast Arts without a staff? Because our lives are so fleetingly short? Because even though we've gone through so much hardship, we can still persevere and live on?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: what reason would you choose?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I don't need to choose any, Alina.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I'm proud just to be an Infected. Because this world still hasn't killed me yet.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And for that matter, we don't need anything to cause us to pursue fairness. We should've been pursuing fairness in the first place, that's why.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And if the world won't give it, we'll just have to take it from it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Then you really are brave.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: You're not laughing at me, are you?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Of course not. How could I?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Mn, well... I feel they're all brave, too. All the people struggling against the fate that's been forced on us.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Then I'm sure you feel—
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Hm.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Feel what?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That our fates are just rotten.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Well, obviously.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I don't feel that way, Talulah.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: ...That's another of your ironic remarks, Alina.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: No... what I mean is, the fact I can sit here, talking with you, knowing we have our guards outside the village protecting us—fate has already been very kind to me.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Don't say that. Fate's a jealous one. Talking about those things is just tempting it to take them away.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But I don't believe in fate, Talulah.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Because you can change it?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Because I can't see it.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Talulah, what you can see, what you can touch, those are things you can rely on.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I can see the cloak I'm holding in my left hand. I can see the candlelight, and I can see the needle I'm holding in my right.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I can see the Infected children's smiles, and I can see the white smoke of vegetables, roasting fragrantly, wafting through the air.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I can see the snow melting, and I can see the two moons dancing spry in the clear night sky.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: And then there's people who can't see even these.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Talulah, if there came a day when we all left you, would you still be able to fight on?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It could always happen. If that time came, would you still feel it was worth it to stand against fate?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Would you possibly think, this is just too much? I just can't do anything anymore?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: If Patriot's taught me anything, then one lesson comes to mind, from long ago at that.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I wouldn't bow my head.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It sneers at me, and I'll be certain to burn it to ash.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You're a blockhead, Talulah. That, or you're getting old.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Hey!
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Only old people get to say that stuff without coming off as naive.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Because if someone's gotten old as old gets and still keeps that outlook all the way, it just means they've gone through far, far too much, to the point the world's left its bitter vestiges on their body, allows them no rest in passing the remainder of their life.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: ...And they're living in the desert of the past. If it were me, I wouldn't even have the courage to take the first step.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: If I were that old and had that much arrogance, I'd be taking the events of the past and stabbing myself with them, every single step I took.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I can't even imagine it. Stuck in the sands of memory, of all the past, how does a person even know they're still moving forwards?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: And what kind of resilient spirit does it take to let them make a new first step, unlike any they've made before?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I feel like you've been hinting at someone this entire time.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I've said I know a lot of what he's done, but I still truthfully don't know Mr. Patriot at all. I've never spoken a single word to him.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: If you say that's him, well, why not. Let it be him.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: If Mr. Patriot...
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: You're fast to substitute.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Ahem.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Unlike all the old, aged warriors, young people can much more easily forget things, give up on things, forgive themselves.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: So you feel like I'm only fighting for all the things I can see? Or, maybe, you're telling me that might not be right?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Compared to the things you'd told me back when we left the village, it's just too shallow.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: In just these few short years, you've already become an outstanding leader. But it's not entirely a good thing for you. You can't let yourself stop here, can you?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: 'If righteousness can only be upheld by greater and greater violence, can it even be called righteous, still? '
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Those words have rolled around in my head for years and years, now. For so many years, I've been constantly thinking it over. I probably haven't gotten it straight yet, but I've been thinking it over and over.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Alright, then. Let's throw fate and making stands and all those other words we were talking about out the window. What is it you want to teach us today, Professor Alina?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Hey. Are you that flippant with FrostNova, too?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Don't joke about that. FrostNova'd freeze both our mouths shut.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Taking you for example, Talulah, you wouldn't fight just to defeat what enemies you see, right?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: The Patrol Unit, the mine overseers, the drafted soldiers following our trail, the Ursus Minister of Medicine... if you defeated all of these, would we be victorious?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Since all of these are awful things, and so we need to defeat them?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Professor Alina wants me to do battle with things I can't see. How would I defeat them, then?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: With things you can promise. Warmth, food, bedding, these are all things you'll be able to touch on some day or other. Think things unlike those.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: This battle of ours probably won't bear results. It's likely we have no way to win.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I'm already not that fond of making promises. Things too far away are near as good as me playing tricks.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: If we can never win, then should we still fight?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Haven't I asked you before? When that time comes, would you still feel this fate is worth you making a stand against it?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Once this is all over, you won't even be able to so much as see your enemies. You'll share those enemies with all those people who can't see a future.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: ...And then, that's when the true battle's really just begun.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: You mention that spirit, those enemies, and those things that carve into ours and the Ursus people's bones.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: —The Emperor?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The Emperor's just one form of it.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: As long as people won't lay down their blades, this conflict will never end.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I don't quite agree. People taking up their blades to fend off what causes them strife is the just thing to do.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You're not wrong. Honestly, this conflict is the sort that'll never end, in my eyes.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Thanks to Mr. Patriot's blessing, I've read no small amount of Leithania and Victoria's books. I very much liked what this one person said...
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: 'Our war is a war against the ego. '
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: It's true, Talulah. As you'll never lay down the swords in your grips—
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: ...So you'll never lay down the needle in your grasp.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And that wraps up our lesson today! There's almost nothing left I can really teach you.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: The children should be studying right now. There's some knowledge they should have by tomorrow.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Talulah... Kashchey wanted you to be a sage, but people all make mistakes.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: When you fall over, you climb back up. But if he won't let you fall over...
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Then all you can do is be a little careful about things.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Same as when you're confronting Patriot. In all honesty, I don't see him and you as two different kinds of people.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: You both already believe too strongly in your own ways. I can't let those any of those lively little creatures go around saying things like you're right, and he's wrong.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: No, Alina. I can't go and do something I don't even believe in myself.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That's true. It's another one of the tricks with which Kashchey bound you, exploited you.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: You're just saying there's no way I can wipe him out, right?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It's a sort of idea, after all. We probably don't have much chance of wiping out an idea...
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: But I'm still just that bit confident.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Confident in what?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: If we're still by your side when that time comes, we'll definitely be able to pull you back.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: It doesn't matter what kind of Arts Kashchey had, we'll definitely have a way of breaking them down. There's always something we can do.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: In this battle, we'll start from words and language, start from the next moment, start from a facial expression. We'll start from now.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: They'll know what mushrooms are safe to eat, how to raise livestock, how to get better a little sooner if you catch a cold.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: We'll try and try not to lose.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: *chuckle*.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And I believe in you. You will have the chance to talk Patriot over.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I'll just force myself to take that as encouragement.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Mm, I'm done sewing. You can give it to her.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I can tell she really cherishes this cloak. It looks like one the army made. And it's three layers inside, three layers outside. It makes it seem really big.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: It probably is an army cloak. That, or it's...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Ah.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: ...Out of all the reasons Mr. Patriot keeps fighting, we just might have found one of them.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Thank you, Alina.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...Wait!
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: What is it? I'm about to prepare tomorrow's lesson. It's a drawing lesson, so they're all looking forward to it.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I'll bring back two brushes for you, next time.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I mean, what I want to say... what I want to ask is, do you really... not want to get to know FrostNova and the others?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The fighters all know we have a good few Infected teachers, it's just that you've been keeping yourself tucked away, all...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Not right now, Talulah.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Once that Infected common ideal of yours becomes reality, we'll naturally come to know each other then.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: And besides, we're all fighters, just on different battlefields. We'll know all about each other sooner or later, won't we?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: You're right, Alina. Infected Fighter, Alina.
attributes.name: Talulah
